200302211557

This was found in the log of another user's workspace (Paul's).  I was looking 
at it for an unrelated defect (eclipse failing to shut down).

!SESSION Mar 05, 2003 16:37:17.930 ---------------------------------------------
java.fullversion=J2RE 1.3.1 IBM Windows 32 build cn131-20020710 (JIT enabled: 
jitc)
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_US
Command-line arguments: -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 -install 
file:D:/RC1/eclipse/
!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui.workbench 4 2 Mar 05, 2003 16:37:17.930
!MESSAGE Problems occurred when invoking code from plug-
in: "org.eclipse.ui.workbench".
!STACK 0
org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Widget is disposed
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2316)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Shell.getDisplay(Shell.java(Compiled Code))
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Shell.getDisplay(Shell.java(Compiled Code))
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Shell.getDisplay(Shell.java(Compiled Code))
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.checkWidget(Widget.java(Compiled 
Code))

Code))
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control.getVisible(Control.java:959)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control.computeTabList(Control.java:441)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite.computeTabList(Composite.java:130)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control.traverseGroup(Control.java:2596)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Shell.open(Shell.java:694)
	at org.eclipse.jface.window.Window.open(Window.java:553)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchWindow.open
(WorkbenchWindow.java:412)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.restoreState(Workbench.java:1158)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.access$9(Workbench.java:1092)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench$10.run(Workbench.java:1010)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.run
(InternalPlatform.java:867)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Platform.run(Platform.java:413)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.openPreviousWorkbenchState
(Workbench.java:962)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.init(Workbench.java:742)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.run(Workbench.java:1242)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run
(InternalBootLoader.java:845)
	at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:461)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:247)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:703)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:539)

We looked at the code and couldn't see how it was happening.  The widget 
becomes disposed while the shell is opening.  The only possibility 
I could see was that the new code that was added to open() to fix the XP 
problem where the icon is wrong if the application doesn't touch the event 
loop in time allows a timer to run and code in this timer disposes the shell.

We could consider reordering the code, but not without a test case and not 
until after 2.1.

I'm going to close this because it's very old and there isn't repeatable 
case.  Sorry.
